prompt.p: Haemophilia is a bleeding disease that occurs almost exclusively in males.
What factor is deficient in Haemophilia A?

modalFeedback.p:
Option C (Factor VIII) is Correct. Factor VIII deficiency is present in 85% of all cases of Haemophilia.
Option A (Von Willebrand factor) is Incorrect. Von Willebrand factor is deficient in Von Willebrand disease.
Option B (Factor V) is Incorrect. Factor V Leiden is a condition in which there is a variant of Factor V leading to hypercoagulability.
Option D (Factor IX) is Incorrect. Factor IX is deficient in Haemophilia B, also known as Christmas disease.
Option E (Factor X) is Incorrect. Deficiency of Factor X is very uncommon.
